title: Getting started with 'ggmapinset'
text: default, geom_sf_inset() creates two copies map layer: one base map inset map. inset transformed clipped, uses underlying aesthetics mapping parameters. want different aesthetics two layers, ’ll need turn copying map_base = "none". parameter set inset parameter provided, inset layer drawn. draw base layer, can use map_inset = "none", inset = NULL, simply use normal geom_sf().
code: cfg <- configure_inset(centre = st_centroid(st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Bladen"]),                        scale = 1.5, translation = c(-180, -50), radius = 50, units = "mi")  ggplot(nc) +   # this is equivalent to the following line:   # geom_sf_inset(fill = "white") +   geom_sf(fill = "white") +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA), inset = cfg, map_base = "none") +   geom_inset_frame(inset = cfg) +   coord_sf()

title: Getting started with 'ggmapinset'
text: default, inset frame transparent, although often makes sense add solid background inset distinguishable overlapping part base map. aesthetics two parts frame burst lines connecting can controlled separately. Note background filled, need specify base inset maps separate layers frame can slip .
code: cfg <- configure_inset(centre = st_centroid(st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Yancey"]),                        scale = 2, translation = c(100, -120), radius = 50, units = "mi")  ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = AREA)) +   geom_inset_frame(inset = cfg, target.params = list(fill = "white")) +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA), inset = cfg, map_base = "none") +   coord_sf()

title: Add Inset Panels to Maps
text: Add zoomed inset panels ggplot maps.

title: Add Inset Panels to Maps
text: can install ggmapinset like :
code: # CRAN release install.packages('ggmapinset')  # development version install.packages('ggmapinset', repos = c('https://cidm-ph.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Add Inset Panels to Maps
text: example adds inset first example ggplot2::geom_sf. inset area defined circle centred named county, radius 50 miles. inset enlarged factor 2 shifted empty part map.
code: library(ggmapinset) library(ggplot2) library(sf)  nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE)  cfg <- configure_inset(centre = st_centroid(st_geometry(nc)[nc$NAME == "Yancey"]),                        scale = 2, translation = c(70, -180), radius = 50, units = "mi")  # The basic ggplot example: # ggplot(nc) + #  geom_sf(aes(fill = AREA))  # Adding an inset means replacing geom_sf(...) -> geom_sf_inset(..., inset = cfg) ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA), inset = cfg) +   geom_inset_frame(inset = cfg) +   coord_sf()

what: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
text: plotting, use geom_sf_inset() instead. helper intended used implementing custom geometries based geom_sf_inset() can provide parameters control inset.

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
code: build_sf_inset_layers(   data,   mapping,   stat,   position,   show.legend,   inherit.aes,   params,   inset,   map_base = "normal",   map_inset = "auto" )

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
text: data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. stat statistical transformation use data layer, either ggproto Geom subclass string naming stat stripped stat_ prefix (e.g. "count" rather "stat_count") position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). params Additional parameters geom stat. inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). map_base Controls layer base map. Possible values "normal" create layer though inset specified, "clip" create layer inset viewport cut , "none" prevent insertion layer base map. map_inset Controls layer inset map. Possible values "auto" choose behaviour based whether inset specified, "normal" create layer viewport cut transformed, "none" prevent insertion og layer viewport map.

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
text: ggplot layer, pair layers.

title: Build layers to implement an inset-compatible geometry — build_sf_inset_layers
code: my_custom_geom <- function(mapping = ggplot2::aes(),                            data = NULL,                            stat = "my_custom_stat",                            position = "identity",                            ...,                            inset = NULL,                            map_base = "normal",                            map_inset = "auto",                            na.rm = TRUE,                            inherit.aes = TRUE) {   params <- rlang::list2(na.rm = na.rm, ...)   build_sf_inset_layers(data = data, mapping = mapping,                         stat = stat, position = position,                         show.legend = show.legend,                         inherit.aes = inherit.aes,                         params = params,                         inset = inset,                         map_base = map_base,                         map_inset = map_inset) }

what: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: configuration returned function passed relevant geometry functions accept inset parameter. ensures use consistent transformation inset.

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
code: configure_inset(   centre,   scale = NULL,   translation = NULL,   radius = NULL,   units = "km",   crs_working = NULL )

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: centre Coordinates inset centre. Ideally sfc object (see sf::st_sfc()) including coordinate reference system. sf::st_point() vector longitude latitude also accepted. CRS determined, crs_working assumed. scale Zoom scale: values larger one make circle bigger. translation Translation (shift) inset relative centre. can st_point simply vector length 2 containing x y offsets respectively. Units specified crs_working. radius Radius inset circle units crs_working. units Base length unit (e.g. "km" "mi"). Ignored crs_working provided. See Details supported values. crs_working coordinate reference system use internally applying transformations. See Details.

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: inset configuration object class inset_config.

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
text: default crs_working uses equidistant cylindrical coordinate reference system latitude true scale set match latitude centre. ensures circle appear circular cases since projection distorted near centre. geometries converted CRS inset transformation constructing inset frame, converted back CRS centre end. default units kilometres can changed units instead specifying whole projection. possible values units understood proj: "mm": millimetre "cm": centimetre "m": metre "ft": foot "us-ft": US survey foot "fath": fathom "kmi": nautical mile "us-ch": US survey chain "us-mi": US survey mile "km": kilometre "ind-ft": Indian foot (1937) "ind-yd": Indian yard (1937) "mi": Statute mile "yd": yard "ch": chain "link": link "dm": decimeter "": inch "ind-ch": Indian chain "us-": US survey inch "us-yd": US survey yard

title: Configure transformations underpinning a map inset — configure_inset
code: library(sf)  # circular inset with a 2x enlargement cfg <- configure_inset(   centre = st_sfc(st_point(c(-82, 35)), crs = 4326),   scale = 2,   translation = c(70, -180),   radius = 50,   units = "mi")

what: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
title: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
text: allows default inset configuration provided avoid repeat layer. layer inset-aware can use default configuration none specifically provided layer.

title: Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
Specify an inset configuration for the whole plot — coord_sf_inset
text: inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). ... Arguments passed ggplot2::coord_sf()

what: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset. — geom_inset_frame
title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset. — geom_inset_frame
text: Add frame burst lines inset.

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset. — geom_inset_frame
code: geom_inset_frame(   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   data = NULL,   stat = "sf",   position = "identity",   ...,   inset = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   source.params = list(),   target.params = list(),   lines.params = list(),   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = FALSE )

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset. — geom_inset_frame
text: mapping, data, stat, position, na.rm, show.legend, inherit.aes, ... See ggplot2::geom_sf() inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). source.params, target.params, lines.params Override aesthetics inset source, target, lines respectively. value list named aesthetics, values scalars length one.

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset. — geom_inset_frame
text: ggplot layer holding inset frame.

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset. — geom_inset_frame
text: Currently inset configuration must passed specifically layer frame built call time instead rest plot built.

title: Add a frame and burst lines for an inset. — geom_inset_frame
code: library(sf) library(ggplot2)  nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE) cfg <- configure_inset(   centre = st_sfc(st_point(c(-82, 35)), crs = 4326),   scale = 2,   translation = c(0, -300),   radius = 50,   units = "mi")  ggplot() + geom_inset_frame(inset = cfg, data = nc)

what: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: wrapper around ggplot2::geom_sf() assists creating map insets. First, configure inset using configure_inset(), pass around configuration object using inset parameter. specifying usual geoms, use geom_inset_frame() add frame around inset connects main map.

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
code: geom_sf_inset(   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   data = NULL,   stat = "sf",   position = "identity",   ...,   inset = NULL,   map_base = c("normal", "clip", "none"),   map_inset = c("auto", "normal", "none"),   na.rm = TRUE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: mapping, data, stat, position, na.rm, show.legend, inherit.aes, ... See ggplot2::geom_sf() inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset(). map_base Controls layer base map. Possible values "normal" create layer though inset specified, "clip" create layer inset viewport cut , "none" prevent insertion layer base map. map_inset Controls layer inset map. Possible values "auto" choose behaviour based whether inset specified, "normal" create layer viewport cut transformed, "none" prevent insertion og layer viewport map.

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: ggplot layer similar ggplot2::geom_sf() transformed according inset configuration.

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
text: Internally works creating two layers: one base map, one inset. can separately controlled map_base map_inset parameters. inset specified, geom instead behave like ggplot2::geom_sf(). inset configured, default creates base inset layers using aesthetic mapping params:   can alternatively specify two layers separately:
code: cfg <- configure_inset(...) geom_sf_inset(aes(...), inset = cfg, ...) # draw the base map only (both versions are equivalent): geom_sf(aes(...), ...) geom_sf_inset(aes(...), inset = cfg, map_inset = "none", ...) # draw the inset map only: geom_sf_inset(aes(...), inset = cfg, map_base = "none", ...)

title: Visualise sf objects with insets — geom_sf_inset
code: library(sf) library(ggplot2)  nc <- sf::st_read(system.file("shape/nc.shp", package = "sf"), quiet = TRUE) cfg <- configure_inset(   centre = st_sfc(st_point(c(-80, 35.5)), crs = 4326),   scale = 1.5,   translation = c(-50, -140),   radius = 50,   units = "mi")  ggplot(nc) +   geom_sf_inset(aes(fill = AREA), inset = cfg) +   geom_inset_frame(inset = cfg)

Transform coordinates according to inset configuration — transform_to_inset
text: x Spatial data frame sf object; see sf::st_geometry(). inset Inset configuration; see configure_inset().

title: Transform coordinates according to inset configuration — transform_to_inset
text: copy x geometry replaced transformed version.

title: Transform coordinates according to inset configuration — transform_to_inset
ggmapinset 0.3.0
text: Added transform_to_inset() helper applying inset transformation arbitrary geometries. Replaced confusing inset_clip inset_copy parameters geom_sf_inset() new map_base map_inset parameters. Inset frame aesthetics can now specified consistently. default inset configuration can passed coord_sf_inset() avoid repeating every layer.

title: ggmapinset 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-02-21 Initial CRAN release.
